Game.title: Game
Game.description: Represents a game available in the GameSphere store.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Game entity.

description.description: A detailed description of the game.

releaseDate.description: The date when the game was released.

genre.description: The genre of the game (e.g., Action, RPG, Strategy).

developerId.description: The ID of the developer user who submitted the game.

imageUrl.description: URL of the game's main image.

status.description: The review status of the game.

User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the GameSphere store.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

email.description: The email address of the user.

registrationDate.description: The date when the user registered.

Review.title: Review
Review.description: Represents a user review for a game.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Review entity.

rating.description: The rating given by the user (e.g., 1 to 5 stars).

comment.description: The text comment provided by the user.

reviewDate.description: The date when the review was submitted.

ShoppingCart.title: ShoppingCart
ShoppingCart.description: Represents the shopping cart for a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ShoppingCart entity.

createdDate.description: The date when the shopping cart was created.

Wishlist.title: Wishlist
Wishlist.description: Represents a user's wishlist of games.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Wishlist entity.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure has been simplified to remove the concept of a separate game submission flow. All games, regardless of status, now live in the `/games` collection. The 'dev' role has been removed from the User entity, as it is no longer needed for game submission.
